name: Buttermilk Sausage Gravy
author: Yoly
summary: This is my husband's recipe that was handed down to him by his grandmother. His grandmother stated that you must use Farmer John® sausage and bacon drippings or it would not taste as delicious as hers. It was never written down, just a pinch of this and a handful of that. I finally got him to measure everything and this is the result.
ingredients: 1 (8 ounce) package pork link sausages (such as Farmer John(R))
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Place sausages and bacon drippings in a skillet and cook over medium heat, breaking up sausage into bite-sized pieces, until golden brown, 4 to 6 minutes
Slowly add buttermilk and cook and stir until gravy has thickened, 3 to 5 minutes
